timeline.headline: India Votes 2014
timeline.text:
Lokasabha Elections 2014 - Coverage of Worlds Biggest Election
By Thejesh GN

date.headline: It’s official: Modi is BJP’s choice
date.text: The formal announcement came after the BJP Parliamentary Board, which Mr. Advani skipped, rubber stamped the nomination after the RSS made it loud and clear in recent days that it wants Mr. Modi’s name announced before the commencement of the ‘inauspicious’ fortnight on September 20.

asset.caption: It’s official: Modi is BJP’s choice

date.headline: Modi authoritarian and a bully, says Ramachandra Guha
date.text: The BJP's prime ministerial candidate Narendra Modi is a "bully" and an "absolute authoritarian", historian Ramchandra Guha said on Wednesday. Guha said the Gujarat chief minister could "damage" the Indian democracy, but not "destroy" it.

asset.caption: Modi authoritarian and a bully, says Ramachandra Guha

date.headline: Frankly Speaking - Rahul Gandi
date.text: For the first time, Congress Vice President and Congress Poll Campaign Chief Rahul Gandhi opens up to an elaborate sit-down interview with TIMES NOW Editor-in-Chief Arnab Goswami.

date.headline: On Twitter
Omar Abdullah: Modi should learn secularism from Kashmiris

asset.caption: Omar Abdullah: Modi should learn secularism from Kashmiris

date.headline: Twin blasts at Farooq Abdullah's rallies
date.text: After Khanyar, the second blast took place at Magam district of Jammu and Kashmir during Jammu & Kashmir National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah's rallies. Three people have been injured in the stampede after the explosion.

asset.caption: Twin blasts at Farooq Abdullah's rallies

date.headline: Kumar Vishwas attacked in Amethi
date.text: LUCKNOW: AAP leader Kumar Vishwas was attacked in Amethi on Friday evening. The attack took place at Singauli village in Jagdishpur block under Kamrauli police station where he had gone to campaign for Lok Sabha election.Vishwas is contesting against Congress vice president Rahul Gandhi. AAP workers alleged that attackers were Congress workers. They also claimed that over 15 AAP volunteers were injured in the attack. Kumar also sustained minor injuries, they claimed.

date.headline: Former Gujarat DGP joins AAP
date.text: RB Sreekumar, who took on Chief Minister Narendra Modi during the 2002 Gujarat riots and thereafter, registered himself with the AAP on Thursday night. Former Director General of Gujarat police RB Sreekumar, who took on Chief Minister Narendra Modi during the 2002 Gujarat riots and thereafter, for the series of alleged fake encounters of Muslims, has joined the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) claiming to fight corruption in high places.

date.headline: RSS to initiate legal action against Rahul Gandhi for accusing them of killing Mahatma Gandhi
date.text: Irked by Rahul Gandhi's remark accusing "RSS people" of having killed Mahatma Gandhi, the Sangh has decided to initiate legal action against him and lodge a complaint with the Election Commission.

asset.caption: RSS to initiate legal action against Rahul Gandhi for accusing them of killing Mahatma Gandhi

date.headline: Finding name is a big issue
date.text: Finding name is a big issue #indiavotes2014 #loksabha2014

date.headline: Voting day in Bangalore
date.text: Volunteers helping to find name in Jayanagar #loksabha2014 #indiavotes2014

date.headline: Voting day in Bangalore
date.text: This is where I voted. Govt Primary School, Kammasandra.

date.headline: Narendra Modi has weak credentials as PM candidate, mine better: Nitish Kumar to NDTV
date.text: Nitish Kumar, the chief minister of Bihar, today told NDTV that he is a far more worthy contender for prime minister than "others."  Without naming his political rival, Narendra Modi - a strategy he has perfected in months of attacks on the BJP's prime ministerial candidate - Mr Kumar demolished the BJP leader's credentials.

asset.caption: Narendra Modi has weak credentials as PM candidate, mine better: Nitish Kumar to NDTV

date.headline: Live: Cabinet recommends President’s rule in Delhi
date.text: The Union Cabinet, which met late this evening at Prime Minister Manmohan Singh's residence, has recommended that President's rule be imposed in Delhi and that the Assembly be kept under suspended animation.

asset.caption: Live: Cabinet recommends President’s rule in Delhi

date.headline: Arvind Kejriwal Resigns
Congress expels six MPs for disrupting Parliament over Telangana
date.text: NEW DELHI: Cracking the whip, Congress on Tuesday expelled six Lok Sabha MPs from Andhra Pradesh who opposed creation of Telangana and had given a notice of no-confidence motion against the government. The MPs expelled by Congress president Sonia Gandhi are Sabbam Hari, GV Harsha Kumar, V Arun Kumar, L Rajagopal, R Sambasiva Rao and A Sai Pratap.

asset.caption: Congress expels six MPs for disrupting Parliament over Telangana

date.headline: Nine-phase Lok Sabha polls begin on April 7, counting on May 16
date.text: For the first time, the Lok Sabha elections will be held in nine phases — from April 7 to May 12. Announcing the poll schedule on Wednesday, the Election Commisson of India said counting of votes will be done on May 16 and the results will be announced on the same day.

asset.caption: Nine-phase Lok Sabha polls begin on April 7, counting on May 16

date.headline: Nine-phase Lok Sabha polls begin on April 7, counting on May 16
date.text: For the first time, the Lok Sabha elections will be held in nine phases — from April 7 to May 12. Announcing the poll schedule on Wednesday, the Election Commisson of India said counting of votes will be done on May 16 and the results will be announced on the same day.

asset.caption: Nine-phase Lok Sabha polls begin on April 7, counting on May 16

date.headline: Lok Sabha elections in 9 phases to start from April 7
date.text: Lok Sabha elections will be held from April 7 to May 12 spread over nine days in the highest number of polling days so far involving an electorate of 81.4 crore, the Election Commission announced on Wednesday.

asset.caption: Lok Sabha elections in 9 phases to start from April 7

date.headline: State-wise map of Election dates for Lok Sabha polls 2014
date.text: Finally the Elections Commission has announced the date for the 2014 Lok Sabha elections, which will be held between April 7 and May 12 in nine phases. The counting of votes will be held on May 16.

asset.caption: State-wise map of Election dates for Lok Sabha polls 2014
